bithi__roy: I see there is a big debate here. In my opinion its surely not promotion of being naked but it is actually about fighting equality. But fighting for equality can be done in many more better ways. Why by hashtaging free the nipple? The title itself involved a human body part. And coming to a man's nipple and woman's nipple.. they are complete different and beautiful in their own way. So why the hell are you putting up a comparison and shouting 'equality'? Equality is when both the genders are treated as humans with equal rights. Equality involves fighting to get the equal and just rights and uplifting the narrow mentality of the society that women are inferior. It doesn't at all mean that we will hashtag free the nipple as a man and woman's nipple are the same. What kind of way is it to fight for equality man? i feel a body part has nothing to relate with equality.. body has nothing to do with women's rights. We all are human beings and we deserve equal rights. That doesn't mean our bodies will become equal to a man! Then where is the uniqueness of being a woman or a man? I don't know whether i am being diplomatic but these are things that did strike me.

ibombets: Dear @aishakhan1109, The world is changing and so are the people with it. Sexual choices are up to individuals for both male and females. No one has or should have the right to pass judgment on it. Accidents happen and can be taken care of very easily nowadays. It's easy to call someone names. Women have started working and are not confined to just being "homemakers" anymore. They can multi task. This is not the 1950s. We have to change with time. Everyone has a right to their own opinion. But being subjected to old school of thoughts and living like that is a disease. Don't spread it around. If the world was left up to you, women would still be confined to their homes, fully covered with no opinions to voice whatsoever. So stop. Think instead. Try. It won't come naturally to you with so many years of conditioning that you probably have. But give it a shot. Don't choose the easy way out. Freedom is our birth right. What we choose to do with it, depends on us and us only. Don't fault parents who are evolved enough to trust their kids. There is no such thing as "faltu freedom". If anything, it's good upbringing. Trust. Give someone that. And the world would be a better place. -21st century.
